stem: An 81-year-old female is brought to the ED by her daughter. Based on the documentation in the Metabolic Inventory & Thermal Regulation Log, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Elderly client with altered mental status and hypothermia.
Background: History of Hypothyroidism. Daughter states her mother 'forgot to take her pills' for several weeks. Found unresponsive in a cold house.
Assessment: Skin is very dry and thickened. Puffy face and periorbital edema noted.
Recommendation: Rule out acute thyroid failure.

tabs.title: Metabolic Inventory & Thermal Regulation Log
tabs.content:
Assessment ItemCurrent FindingInterpretation
Core Temperature94.2°F (34.6°C)Severe Hypothermia
Mental StatusStuporous; Weak response to stimulusDepressed CNS
Serum TSH92.0 mIU/L (High)Severe primary failure
Free T40.1 ng/dL (Low)Critical insufficiency

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 88/52, HR 42 (Bradycardia), RR 8 (Shallow), SpO2 86% on RA.

actionOptions.text: Apply passive rewarming with blankets and warm IV fluids
Prepare for emergent IV Levothyroxine (T4) administration
Administer high-dose Beta-blockers to control the heart rate
Apply cooling blankets and ice packs to the axilla

parameterOptions.text: Respiratory effort and arterial blood gases (ABGs)

rationale.correct: The client presents with a clinical triad of Myxedema Coma (c2): Hypothermia, severe Bradycardia, and Respiratory depression (RR 8). The low T4 and extremely high TSH confirm severe hypothyroidism. Actions focus on gentle warming (a1) and replacing the missing hormone (a2). Parameters must include temperature (p1) and respiratory status (p2), as respiratory failure is a common cause of death in this condition.
clinicalPearls: TSH is high because the pituitary is screaming for T4, but the thyroid cannot produce it.
Rewarming must be PASSIVE; active external warming can cause rapid vasodilation and shock.
Myxedema coma is often triggered by an infection, surgery, or stopping thyroid medication.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Use blankets and warm fluids (Passive). Avoid heating pads or aggressive active rewarming as it can cause vascular collapse.

mnemonic.title: Low and Slow
mnemonic.expansion: L-Low Temp. S-Slow HR. L-Low BP. S-Slow Resp.
